_meta.source: TradingView FactSet Industries & Economic Sectors — USA
notes: All sector and industry names verified directly from tradingview.com/markets/stocks-usa/sectorandindustry-sector/*/industries/
Coal: No dedicated US-listed coal ETF exists (KOL was delisted 2020). XLE used as fallback.
Pharmaceuticals Generic: Only 1 stock on TradingView. GNRX was delisted 2019. XPH used as fallback.
Textiles: No dedicated ETF. XLB (sector) used as fallback.
Electronic Production Equipment: No dedicated fab-equipment-only ETF. SMH used (includes AMAT, LRCX, KLAC).
Forest Products / Construction Materials: No dedicated ETFs. XME / XLB used as fallbacks.
Communications sector in TradingView FactSet = pure telecom only (3 industries). Media/Entertainment live in Consumer Services.

industries.name: Semiconductors
industries.note: NVDA, TSMC, AMD, AVGO

industries.note: Apple dominates this category ($3T+)

industries.note: AMAT, LRCX, KLAC, ASML — semiconductor fab equipment. No dedicated ETF; SMH is closest.

TradingView_Master_Mapping._note: IMPORTANT: TradingView's Communications sector has ONLY these 3 industries. Broadcasting, Movies/Entertainment, Cable/Satellite, Media are in Consumer Services. XLC covers both, but IYZ is more accurate for pure telecom.

industries.name: Restaurants
industries.note: AdvisorShares Restaurant ETF — MCD, SBUX, CMG, YUM

industries.name: Hotels/Resorts/Cruise lines
industries.note: Invesco Leisure & Entertainment — MAR, HLT, CCL, NCLH. CRUZ was cruise-only (wrong).

industries.name: Movies/Entertainment
industries.note: Netflix, Disney, WBD — TradingView puts this in Consumer Services, NOT Communications

industries.name: Cable/Satellite TV
industries.note: Comcast, Charter, DirecTV — in Consumer Services, NOT Communications

industries.name: Broadcasting
industries.note: Fox, Paramount, Nexstar — in Consumer Services, NOT Communications
